result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: for purposes of paying service fees in 15CF23

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. McClain

defendant.name: McClain, Christopher M.
defendant.address: N10011 County Road F, Phillips, WI 54555

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:31 am - 14CF14, 15CF35, 15CF23 - Defendant Christopher M. McClain in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states plea agreement. Court questions DE regarding agreement. DA moves to amend 14CF14 to 940.19(1).  Granted. DE pleads NO CONTEST to 14CF14, Cts. 2 & 4 in 15CF23.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, questions DE regarding elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 14CF14 and Cts. 2 & 4 in 15CF23 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in 15CF35 for purposes of paying service fees and dismisses and reads in Phillips PD referral #14-625 for purposes of no further prosecution and dismisses Cts. 1 & 3 in 15CF23. Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:46 am. 
Court imposes:
14CF14 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions: $65 SBDA; court costs
15CF23 (Ct. 2) - $831 fine; 45 day DL revocation - $50/month starting 30 days after release or order to show cause
15CF23 (Ct. 4) - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions: $300 fine; $115 SBDA (15CF35); AODA

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court.

10:15 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Christopher M. McClain in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appearing telephonically.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant lifted.  Information given by Snyder.  Hearing adjourned.  Back on record at 10:27.  Move to initial.  Complaint acknowleged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Defendant does not appear. Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court orders warrant $150 + $25WF.
